intro: Thismia terengganuensis, commonly known as the Terengganu Thismia, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the Malaysian state of Terengganu. It belongs to the family Thismiaceae, a group of plants characterized by their lack of chlorophyll and reliance on mycorrhizal fungi for nutrition. The plant produces small, white, non-showy flowers that are typically found underground or at the base of its foliage. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
